tab_content.accordion_title: Can I talk to a doctor on Maple about my stasis dermatitis?
tab_content.accordion_intro: Yes. In most cases, a doctor on Maple can treat stasis dermatitis online by asking about your symptoms and by taking a look at your skin through a photo or by video. Once you describe your symptoms to the doctor, they’ll be able to provide a diagnosis, write necessary prescriptions, and recommend an appropriate course of treatment. If the doctor suspects you have a more serious problem, they may suggest for you to go to a clinic for a thorough physical examination.
tab_content.accordion_content: In select provinces, you can also request to see a dermatologist right on Maple about your stasis dermatitis. To learn more about how our online dermatology assessments work, please click here.

tab_content.accordion_title: Can I get a prescription on Maple?
tab_content.accordion_intro: Yes, our physicians can prescribe medications online during your consultation. Once you accept a prescription, you’ll have the option to pick it up from any pharmacy or to have it delivered right to your door at no additional cost.
tab_content.accordion_content: You can visit our How it Works page to learn more.

tab_content.accordion_intro: Dermatitis is a group of diseases resulting in the inflammation of the skin. It can cause the skin to darken, develop rough or scaly patches, swell, crust, and ooze.
tab_content.accordion_content: Stasis dermatitis (or gravitational dermatitis) is a condition which can develop in people with poor blood circulation. It is most commonly found in the lower leg area and is caused by the build-up of pressure in the veins and surrounding tissues.

tab_content.accordion_title: What are the symptoms of stasis dermatitis?
tab_content.accordion_intro:
Symptoms of stasis dermatitis include:

  • Swelling around ankle
  • Change in skin colour
  • Pain in calf area
  • Itching and swelling
  • Ulcers

tab_content.accordion_title: How can I treat stasis dermatitis?
tab_content.accordion_intro: Doctors can prescribe a variety of different medications to help treat stasis dermatitis. These can include skin creams and ointments like lanolin and calamine. For more severe situations, doctors doctors may prescribe topical steroid creams and antibiotics.
tab_content.accordion_content: It’s also important to reduce stress on the legs which you can do by avoiding standing for long periods of time, wearing compression stockings, and elevating your feet while sitting.

tab_content.accordion_intro:
With Maple, you can start talking to a doctor about your symptoms in a matter of minutes. We’re a healthcare app for fast, convenient 24/7 access to Canadian doctors.

tab_content.accordion_content: Additionally, for select provinces, you may see a dermatologist on Maple about your stasis dermatitis the same way you would request a consultation with a general practitioner.
